block.p: Weeks
This
On
Week
List
Fiction
RIVER'S END, by Nora Roberts. (Jove, $7.99.) The daughter of a glamorous Hollywood couple must cope with her family's horrifying past.
WHERE THE HEART IS, by Billie Letts. (Warner, $12.) A pregnant teenager finds help and caring in a small Oklahoma town.
THE KILLING GAME, by Iris Johansen. (Bantam, $6.99.) A forensic sculptor hopes to find her murdered daughter's remains.
BLACK FRIDAY, by James Patterson. (Warner Vision, $6.99.) A militia lays siege to New York.
THE BLUEST EYE, by Toni Morrison. (Plume, $12.95.) The story of an 11-year-old black girl -- pregnant by her father -- who prays for blue eyes.
WE'LL MEET AGAIN, by Mary Higgins Clark. (Pocket, $7.99.) A woman tries to free herself of the suspicion that she murdered her husband.
THE RIGHT HAND OF EVIL, by John Saul. (Ballantine, $7.99.) When a family moves into its ancestral home, terrible secrets begin to emerge.
THE TESTAMENT, by John Grisham. (Island, $7.99.) A billionaire, a lawyer and a missionary are brought together by a startling secret.
THE SAVING GRACES, by Patricia Gaffney. (HarperTorch, $6.99.) The close friendship that binds four women is put to the test.
HARRY POTTER AND THE SORCERER'S STONE, by J. K. Rowling. (Scholastic, $5.99.) A British boy attends a school for witchcraft.
SERPENT, by Clive Cussler with Paul Kemprecos. (Pocket, $7.99.) The Andrea Doria's remains yield treasures that point to a deadly conspiracy.
THE GIRLS' GUIDE TO HUNTING AND FISHING, by Melissa Bank. (Penguin, $12.95.) The progress of a young New York woman through the terrain of sex and love.
WHITE OLEANDER, by Janet Fitch. (Back Bay/Little, Brown, $13.95.) The ordeals of growing up as experienced by a teenage girl whose single mother murders a lover.
LAKE NEWS, by Barbara Delinsky. (Pocket Star, $7.99.) A singer returns to her hometown.
TOM CLANCY'S NET FORCE: Night Moves, created by Tom Clancy and Steve Pieczenik. (Berkley, $7.99.) Computer terrorism in 2011.
*A NEW SONG, by Jan Karon. (Penguin, $12.95.) A clergyman and his wife move 600 miles away.
Weeks
This
On
Week
List
Nonfiction
THE SEAT OF THE SOUL, by Gary Zukav. (Fireside/S&S, $12.) How daily activities can be enhanced by feelings of meaning and purpose. (+)
GIRL, INTERRUPTED, by Susanna Kaysen. (Vintage, $12.) A young woman's mental illness.
A CHILD CALLED ''IT,'' by Dave Pelzer. (Health Communications, $9.95.) The autobiography of a man who survived his mother's abuse. (+)
WE ARE OUR MOTHERS' DAUGHTERS, by Cokie Roberts. (HarperPerennial, $11.) The television news anchor's reflections on women.
BELLA TUSCANY, by Frances Mayes. (Broadway, $15.) An American remembers a spring and summer spent in the romantic sections of Italy.
*ANGELA'S ASHES, by Frank McCourt. (Touchstone/S&S, $14 and $7.99.) An Irish-American writer recalls his childhood in Limerick.
*THE PERFECT STORM, by Sebastian Junger. (HarperPerennial, $14; HarperPaperbacks, $6.99.) The story of the northeaster of 1991.
*THE ELEGANT UNIVERSE, by Brian Greene. (Vintage, $15.) A presentation of superstring theory.
*THE LOST BOY, by Dave Pelzer. (Health Communications, $10.95.) The author of ''A Child Called 'It' ''recalls his life in foster homes. (+)
*THE ONION'S FINEST NEWS REPORTING, edited by Scott Dikkers and Robert Siegel. (Three Rivers, $16.) A collection of humor pieces.
RAISING CAIN, by Dan Kindlon and Michael Thompson with Teresa Barker. (Living Planet/ Ballantine, $14.) The emotional life of boys.
*THE MILLIONAIRE NEXT DOOR, by Thomas J. Stanley and William D. Danko. (Pocket, $14.) An analysis of the lives of wealthy Americans. (+)
*TRAVELING MERCIES, by Anne Lamott. (Anchor, $13.) A chronicle of the author's journey toward faith and spirituality.
*GUNS, GERMS, AND STEEl, by Jared Diamond. (Norton, $14.95.) A physiologist attributes Western dominance to geography. (+)
THE PROFESSOR AND THE MADMAN, by Simon Winchester. (HarperPerennial, $13.) How a murderer helped compile the O.E.D.
*EVERY MAN A TIGER, by Tom Clancy with Chuck Horner. (Berkley, $16.95.) The novelist and a retired Air Force general examine the gulf war.
Weeks
This
On
Week
List
Advice, How-to and Miscellaneous
CHICKEN SOUP FOR THE mother's souL, compiled by Jack Canfield, Mark Victor Hansen, Jennifer Read Hawthorne and Marci Shimoff. (Health Communications, $12.95.) Inspiration. (+)
CHICKEN SOUP FOR THE TEENAGE SOUL III, compiled by Jack Canfield et al. (Health Communications, $12.95.) Inspiration. (+)
RICH DAD, POOR DAD, by Robert T. Kiyosaki with Sharon L. Lechter. (Warner, $15.95.) Teaching one's children how to get rich and stay rich.
DR. ATKINS' NEW DIET REVOLUTION, by Robert C. Atkins. (Avon, $14 and $6.99.) A physician recommends ways to lose weight and achieve a healthy body. (+)

Rankings reflect sales, for the week ending May 13, at almost 4,000 bookstores plus wholesalers serving 60,000 other retailers, statistically weighted to represent all such outlets. An asterisk (*) indicates that a book's sales are barely distinguishable from those of the book above. A dagger (+)indicates that some stores received bulk orders. Expanded rankings are available at The New York Times on the Web: www.nytimes.com/books.
